subject: Politics
title: Judicial Corruption
description: A micro-lesson that makes Judicial Corruption usable.

hook.text: In some countries, the verdict depends on who pays the judge. When courts are for sale, justice is fiction.

buildup.text: Judicial corruption means judges accepting bribes, ruling for political allies, or trading verdicts for favors.

discovery.text: In Pakistan and India, court delays and corruption mean cases drag for decades. Justice delayed is justice denied.

twist.text: Even in rich democracies, judicial independence faces threats. Elected judges may rule to please voters, not uphold law.

climax.text: Independent courts are the last defense against tyranny. When they fall, there's no check on power left.

punchline.text: Corrupt courts don't deliver justice. They deliver whatever power pays for.

quiz.question: Why are independent courts essential for democracy?
options: They serve as the last check against tyranny and abuse of power
Courts have no role in democratic governance
Judges should always rule based on public opinion polls
